recipe.name: Chili Con Carne Corn Bread Pie
recipe.description: These pies are filled with Chili Con Carne and topped with corn bread! The corn bread batter only takes a few minutes to make. You can make on large pie or individual pies. You can also add vegetables into the filling - corn and peas would go especially well.
recipeIngredient: 4 cups Shredded Beef Chili Con Carne
1 1/2 cups self raising flour ((or 3 tsp baking powder plus 1 1/4 cups + 3 tbsp of plain flour))

recipeInstructions.text: Place 1 cup of Shredded Beef Chili Con Carne into 4 individual pie dishes, or 1 large pie dish.
recipeInstructions.name: Place 1 cup of Shredded Beef Chili Con Carne into 4 individual pie dishes, or 1 large pie dish.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine Corn Bread Topping dry ingredients in a bowl and given them a quick stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine Corn Bread Topping dry ingredients in a bowl and given them a quick stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add Corn Bread Topping wet ingredients and mix to combine until lump free.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Corn Bread Topping wet ingredients and mix to combine until lump free.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour corn bread mixture over filling so it is about 1.5 cm / 1/2" thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour corn bread mixture over filling so it is about 1.5 cm / 1/2" thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Place pie in the oven and bake for 20 to 30 minutes until golden brown on top. If making one large one, it will take closer to 35 minutes. To test for doneness, insert a skewer in the middle of the corn bread and make sure it comes out clean. If there is batter on the skewer, return to oven.

review.reviewBody: Made this tonight. I used my regular nacho chilli recipe and put the cornbread on top. Turned out beautifully, eaten with sour cream and salsa. My original plan was to freeze the leftovers but that's not going to be an issue. :D
So yummy and the muffins made with the extra mixture are amazing, this will be my go to corn muffin recipe from now on

Just had this for dinner tonight and our guest wasn’t a fan of chilli con carne until he tried your recipe. He couldn’t stop saying how good it was and had three servings. The corn bread do such a great match and so tasty. I think I’ll always have chilli now with cornbread.
This was absolutely delicious!!! It will become a winter staple.
